description: This walk combines the Watagan Cycle Track with the Fernleigh Rail Trail to visit Green Point, the Belmont Wetlands, and optionally Awabakal and Glenrock.

markers.description: Get the train to Teralba using transportnsw.info.
Exit the station on the side of the pub.
From the station follow Anzac Pde straight on.
Just before Five Islands Rd follow the Great North Walk marker to the left down Lake Cres.
From the end of Lake Cres continue along the shared path.
At the intersection follow the shared path to the right to the overpass.
From the intersection follow the bike path under the overpass.
Follow the shared path along Five Islands Rd to the right.
Follow the shared path across the Cockle Creek.
On the other side of Cocke Creek follow the shared path down the off ramp to the right.
From the off ramp follow Creek Reserve Rd to the left past the sportsfields.
Follow the Watagan Cycle Track into Speers Point Park. There is a toilet block at the carpark.
There is cafe at the pavilion.
From the pavilion follow the Watagan Cycle Track to the left along the waterfront.
At the other side of Speers Point Park, follow the Watagan Cycle Track around the carpark.
From the carpark follow the Watagan Cycle Track along the Esplanade.
Follow the Watagan Cycle Track to the Warner Bay Foreshore Reserve. There is a toilet block at the picnic area.
From the Warner Bay Foreshore continue following the  Watagan Cycle Track along the lakefront.
At the split follow the path left across the bridge.
Follow the Watagan Cycle Track along the Red Bluff Boardwalk.
From the end of the boardwalk cross at the nearby traffic lights and continue right along Macquarie Dr.
At the intersection follow Harkins St a short distance to the left.
At the intersection follow Croft Rd to the right.
At the intersection follow Pannamena Cr to the end.
At the end of Pannamena Cr cross Bareki Rd to the bus stop.
The safest place to cross is from the nearby driveway.
Follow Toonibal Ave to the left behind the bus stop.
From the end of Toonibal Ave, continue on the shared path.
Follow the shared path into Croudace Park past the boat ramp.
There is a toilet block near the board ramp carpark.
There is another toilet block near the playground.
Follow any path through the park to the other side.
From the end of the park follow Macquarie Dr to the right across the bridge.
At the servo follow Tallawalla Rd to the right.
At the intersection follow Dilkera Ave to the right.
Follow Dilkera Ave to the amenities at Allambee Park.
There is a toilet block in Allembee Park.
From the shops follow Dilkera Ave to Bennett Park.
At the end of Dilkera Ave continue on the bike path to the right for a short distance.
From the bike path follow the bush trail to the right.
Follow the trails and boardwalks along the shorefront.
From the intersection follow the bike path to the right.
Continue following the bike path along the picnic area.
Continue following the bike path along the waterfront.
From the end of the bike path continue following Ross St.
At the intersection follow Ross St to the right.
Follow the Ross St to the Belmont Wharf. There is a toilet block at the picnic area.
From the Belmont Wharf follow Macquarie St to the left.
At the intersection follow the Pacific Hwy to the right along the shops.
Get the bus to Belmont using transportnsw.info.
Cross the Pacific Hwy at the traffic lights and follow Gen St to the left.
From the corner of Gen St enter the former Belmont Railway Station on the right.
From the former station follow the Fernleigh Track.
The start of the Fernleigh railway line, but also the start of an historic trek.
markers.title: I'm a Choo Choo Train: Belmont
markers.instruction: Visit this location to earn the mystery trophy

markers.description: There is a toilet block at the end of the former Belmont Railway Station.
Continue following the Fernleigh Track through the Belmont Wetlands.
Follow the sign to the Wildflower Walk to the left.
From the trail marker for the Wildflower Walk to the right.
Follow the trail markers along the Wildflower Walk.
At the end of the Wildflower Walk follow the Fernleigh Track to the left.
End of the wetlands and start of suburbia.
markers.title: I'm a Choo Choo Train: Jewells
markers.instruction: Visit this location to earn the mystery trophy

markers.description: At the former Jewels Station cross Kalaroo Rd and continue on the Fernleigh Track.
A sign on the right side of the Fernleigh Track advertising 'butt cream' indicates a trailhead at a cafe.
Follow the sign to Redhead Beach from the right side of the Fernleigh Track.
Alight here for Awabakal Nature Reserve and Redhead Beach.
markers.title: I'm a Choo Choo Train: Redhead
markers.instruction: Visit this location to earn the mystery trophy

markers.description: -5km Alternatively from the former Redhead Railway Station keep following the Fernleigh Track.
This section of the Fernleigh Track bypasses the coastal walk.
There is a toilet block at the former Whitebridge Railway Station.
No longer a stop for trains, but now one for coffee and cakes up there.
markers.title: I'm a Choo Choo Train: Whitebridge
markers.instruction: Visit this location to earn the mystery trophy

markers.description: There are amenities nearby the former Whitebridge Railway Station.
From the former Whitebridge Railway Station follow the Fernleigh Track to the former Kahiba Railway station.
Glenrock's a good reason to leave the train here.
markers.title: I'm a Choo Choo Train: Kahibah
markers.instruction: Visit this location to earn the mystery trophy

markers.description: At the intersection follow Elsdon St to the right.
At the bus stop cross Kalaroo Rd and cross O'Connor Park.
At the other side of O'Connor Park follow Elsdon St to the right.
After the corner in Elsdon St enter the trailhead of Owens Walkway on the right.
From the trailhead follow Owens Walkway to the left to the beach.
Follow the boardwalk through the dunes.
Follow the boardwalk to the left to the picnic area.
From the end of Owens Walkway cross Webb Park.
There's a toilet block at the playground.
From the carpark of Webb Park follow Beach Rd to the right.
Cross Freshwater Creek along the footpath.
After crossing Freshwater Creek follow Alison St to the left.
From the corner of Alison St follow Collier St to the right.
Follow the trailhead into Awabakal Nature Reserve on the left side of Collier St.
Follow the trail markers from the trailhead into Awabakal Nature Reserve.
The narrow tunnel of dense vegetation opens up to expansive coastal heath.
markers.title: The Rear Entrance
markers.instruction: Visit this location to earn the mystery trophy

markers.description: Follow the Redhead Trail through the coastal heath of Awabakal Nature Reserve.
From the intersection follow the Ocean St Trail to the left. There is a lookout a short distance to the right.
From the picnic area follow Ocean St Trail straight ahead.
Exit the park through the gate and continue following Ocean St.
From the cul-de-sac follow Ocean St.
There is a toilet block in Reay Park at the bus stop.
At the intersection follow Bombala St to the right.
At the split continue follow Bombala St to the left.
From the carpark at the end of Bombala St continue following the Bombala St Track.
At the split in the track follow the sign to Dudley Beach to the left.
From the lookout follow the steps down to Dudley Beach.
From the end of the track continue follow Dudley Beach.
After the lagoon find the end of the firetrail in the dunes.
Follow the firetrail through the dunes.
Follow the mountain bike trail to the right up the headland.
At the top of the mountain bike run follow The Goat Trail to the right.
At the lookout follow The Goat Trail to the left.
Follow The Goat Trail past the lookouts across Glenrock Lagoon.
After the lookouts follow the steps to the left.
At the gated trailhead follow Scout Camp Rd to the right.
From the left side of Scout Camp Rd follow the sign to the Burwood Track.
Follow the track past the creek crossing.
From the intersection follow the Yuelarbah Track to the right.
Follow the Yuelarbah Track past the bridge.
From the end of the Yuelarbah Track continue across the carpark.
From the end of the carpark follow Burwood Rd to the right.
At the pedestrian crossing follow the Fernleigh Track to the right.
Follow the Fernleigh Track through the former railway tunnel.
Use the pedestrian crossing and continue following the Fernleigh Track.
From the roundabout at end of the Fernleigh Track follow Park Ave straight ahead to the station.
End of the line for the Fernleigh Track. From here you get to ride a real train.
markers.title: I'm a Choo Choo Train: Adamstown
markers.instruction: Visit this location to earn the mystery trophy

markers.description: Plan your return trip from Adamstown at transportnsw.info.
+3km For a more frequent train service follow Glebe Rd ro the right from the station.
Cross Glebe Rd at the bus stop and follow Terlaba Rd to the left.
From the intersection follow Melville Rd to the left.
From the end of Melville Rd follow Coorumbing Rd to the right, underneath the overpass, and to the station.
Plan your return trip from Broadmeadow at transportnsw.info.
